document.docAuthor: Yahyapour, Eliye, Shayanmehr, Masoumeh, Vafaei-Shoushtari, Reza & Arbea, Javier I.
document.docTitle: Heteraphorura kaprusi Arbea, Yahyapour & Shayanmehr 2020, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: A review of the Iranian species of the family Onychiuridae (Collembola Poduromorpha), with description of five new species from Hyrcanian Forests in Iran

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A review of the Iranian species of the family Onychiuridae (Collembola Poduromorpha), with description of five new species from Hyrcanian Forests in Iran

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type locality.
Iran , Mazandaran Province , Sari county , Salardare forest ,
28 m a.s.l.
( 36º32ʹ59ʺ N , 53º7ʹ31ʺ E )
.

Type material.
Holotype female, Mazandaran Province , Sari county , Salardare forest , soil and leaf litter,
29 April 2016
, leg. Eliye Yahyapour.
Paratypes :All specimens from same locality as holotype, 3 females
.
Holotype and 1 paratype deposited in MNCN , 2 paratypes in SANRU
.

Other material:
Iran , Mazandaran Province , Tonekabon county , Dohezar forest ,
443 m a.s.l.
, ( 36º40ʹ21.7ʺ N , 50º49ʹ28.5ʺ E ), soil and leaf litter, leg. Eliye Yahyapour ,
10 November 2016
, 1 male and 3 juveniles . Deposited in SANRU
.
Etymology. The species is dedicated to our colleague Igor Kaprus’ who has greatly contributed to the knowledge of Iranian Onychiuridae .

PAO in long cuticular groove with 2 border chaetae (pbc), consisting of 18–20 granulated vesicles ( Fig. 6 ). Maxillary outer lobe with simple palp, basal chaeta and with two sublobal hairs. Labial palp of AC type . Labium with 7 proximal, 4 basomedian and 6 basolateral chaetae. Papillae A–E with 1, 4, 0, 3, 3 guard chaetae respectively. Labral formula of chaetae: 4/342 ( Fig. 10 ).

Pso formula dorsally: 20/011/11024, ventral pso absent. Localization of dorsal pso is presented in Figs 2–3 . Psx formula ventrally: 1/000/ 110101m . Subcoxae 1 of I–III legs with one psx each in posterior position. Femur of all legs with one psx on internal side.

Dorsal chaetotaxy usually symmetrical, ordinary chaetae well differentiated into macro-, meso- and microchaetae ( Figs 1 , 8 ). Dorsal cephalic chaeta d0 present. Th. I with 7–8+7–8 chaetae. Th. II and III with lateral ms each and 3+3 axial chaetae. Abd. I–III with 3+3 axial chaetae (m1 present). Sometimes chaetae m1 absent on Abd. III. Abd. IV with one (p0) or two (a0, p0) median chaetae. Abd. V with one (m0) or two (a0, m0) median chaetae. Abd. VI with three median chaetae a0, m0 and p0 ( Fig. 1 ). AS set closely together, rather strong, weakly curved, pointed, with distinct basal papillae, as long as claw.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 2–6.
Heteraphorura kaprusi
sp. nov.
: 2, head and Th. dorsal chaetotaxy; 3, Abd. dorsal chaetotaxy; 4, Abd. ventral chaetotaxy of a female; 5, Abd. ventral chaetotaxy of a male; 6, PAO. pbc—posterior border chaetae. Scales: 0.2 mm (2–5), 0.05 mm (6).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Discussion. According to Arbea (2014) the new species belongs to the oriental species-group of the genus characterized by granulated vesicles in PAO.
H. kaprusi
sp. nov.
is characterized by 4+4 pso on Abd. V. Whitin the genus only the Japanese
H. japonica ( Yosii, 1967 )
can possesses 4+4 pso on Abd. V, but both species differ in dorsal chaetotaxy (see Table 1 ). The new species is the most similar to
H. iranica
Kaprus’, Shayanmehr & Kahrarian, 2017 (in: Kaprus’ et al . 2017) from Iran . Both species have similar dorsal chaetotaxy, the same number of pso on antennal base, and structure of PAO. The new species can be easily distinguished from
H. iranica
by the number of pso on Abd. V, the length of empodial appendage and some details in the chaetotaxy, eg in Th. II–III the p3 chaeta is a macrochaeta in
H. iranica
while it is a mesochaeta in the new species (see Table 1 ).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 7–12.
Heteraphorura kaprusi
sp. nov.
: 7, anal valves chaetotaxy; 8, Ant. III and IV; 9, tibiotarsus and claw III; 10, labrum; 11, pso and p1–p4 chaetae on Abd. II; 12, pso and p1–p4 chaetae on Abd. V. Scales: 0.1 mm (7), 0.05 mm (8–12).

TABLE 1. Comparison of the oriental species group of
Heteraphorura
with compound vesicles in PAO. m1—m1 chaetae on Abd. I-III; E/C—ratio empodial appendage length/
inner edge of the claw; PAO—number of vesicles on PAO; IT—unpaired inner tooth of claw; T2–3, A1–3, A4 and, A5—chaetae p1,p2,p3 on Th. II–III, Abd. I–III, Abd. IV and
Abd. V, respectively; A6—axial chaetae on Abd. VI; – = absent; + = present; m = mesochaeta; M = Macrochaeta.
